title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach
Interview Descriptions: Easy, didn’t ask much questions more so asked about my life and school. Asked about my workload as a student and how will I handle different types of students and working with difficult people. Scenario based questions.
Interview Questions: Not applicable. Life questions more so.

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CSU Long Beach
Interview Descriptions: Asked questions about my thought process when conducting labs such as reading the lab manuals in an orderly manner and experience with hands on stuff and want a resume as well.
Interview Questions: Can I follow directions effectively during an experiment?

title: Evaluator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CSU Long Beach
Interview Descriptions: Two interview sessions. The first one was a panel session and the second was a one on one. Be prepared for a lot of questions in the first interview. Make sure to have real like examples to relate to the role.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have in the field?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach
Interview Descriptions: Asked questions about audio and made sure that I was comfortable working with teachers as well as learning a new program called hyflex. It went really well. I got the job and have worked there for 2 years
Interview Questions: Are you comfortable working with professors and teaching them

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CSU Long Beach
Interview Descriptions: Took a few classes with a professor and performed well. Got a brief introduction of the research material in said professor's class and had an offline conversation during office hours about research opportunities. Professor reviewed academic performance and provided material to go through to observe time-management, and other skills.
Interview Questions: Are you able to work 20 hours a week with your current schedule?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CSU Long Beach
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with 3 people, lasted 30 mins. Easy questions with multi part answers. Ex tell me about a time you ran into a problem, how you approached it, and what the outcome was.
Interview Questions: Please see above example in description

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CSU Long Beach
Interview Descriptions: Simple and straightforward. Basic knowledge of research and enthusiasm for academia was the focus of the interview. Background was also important due to the field of study, as well as prior research experience and conference preparation/presentation experience.
Interview Questions: What is your Background in Research?

title: Instructional Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach
Interview Descriptions: Fairly straightforward, fill out an online application. Make sure to make a custom resume using the wording from the job listing. Think of relevant stories for each skill that they are looking for.  Zoom interview.
Interview Questions: There was a panel interview where they asked questions based on the job posting.

title: Peer Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interview lasted around 15-20 minutes. Depending on the length of the questions and answers. There are around 10 questions being asked. Interview had the typical questions to know someone’s experience and general idea of handling interaction with other people.
Interview Questions: What previous experience do you have with customer service?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CSU Long Beach
Interview Descriptions: Met with head of the department and talked about previous experience I had with teaching and the content. Was a brief interview since I did have previous tutoring and teaching experience.
Interview Questions: What past teaching experience do I have and in what topics?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach
Interview Descriptions: Quick one on one with the manager, very chill and easygoing. Then another student worker was interviewing me as well. Asked quirky questions like what tree would I be if I had to pick.
Interview Questions:
What is your schedule? 
What is your major?

title: Admissions Evaluator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach
Interview Descriptions: It was a "virtual job fair" for three different positions. Intro with the Director for an hour and then you went to a separate screens and had to wait for your turn and depending on the position you applied, they'll assign you with a team. I waited almost 3 hours for my turn. They only asked 3 questions in the first round. Then scheduled another interview with the Director.
Interview Questions: They asked about my current process as an evaluator.

title: Server Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CSU Long Beach
Interview Descriptions: it was a easy interview and almost everyone gets hired.  Ask simple questions like why you want to work here and what not. It’s a group interview with the superior and lead.
Interview Questions: why you want to work here

title: Instructional Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CSU Long Beach
Interview Descriptions: Email was sent to me about the vacancy from program advisor with the email ID of the hiring professor . And I sent an email including my resume to that professor
Interview Questions: Previous experience, About my current course.

title: Store Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach
Interview Descriptions: A simple and easy interview. Make sure to be friendly but overall just be truthful. Be sure you can adapt to different projects and things since it can change a lot. Customer service is a big part of the job so make sure you have tough skin.
Interview Questions:
Work ethic?
How would you describe yourself?
How would you handle a difficult customer?

title: Peer Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach (Long Beach, CA) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: Look for jobs on the CSULB website, apply for the job even if you don't fit the description since they use job requirements/descriptions to filter people out. After sending the application, you will receive a notification that they've received your application and that you need to wait for them to review it and send you a follow-up e-mail for job interview.
Interview Questions: Give an example of the time you demonstrated leadership in your workplace.

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CSU Long Beach
Interview Descriptions: It was very straight forward basic interview questions. They got back to me fairly quickly! It was overall a good experience. I liked working on campus and it’s convenience.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest weakness.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CSU Long Beach
Interview Descriptions: Asked me about my research interest, goals. It was kind of behavioral  interview. It was 45 minutes interview. Most of the questions were very general. Only one question was specific.
Interview Questions: Why you are interested to do a research with me?

title: IT Support Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach
Interview Descriptions: Fairly easy and straight forward with some technical and behavioral. It is a 30 min process with two interviewers asking questions from your resume . Read the job description and expect questions from your resume.
Interview Questions: What are some of the transferrable skills you will bring to this role.

title: Student Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach (Long Beach, CA) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Interview was a process in which i was interviewed and asked questions in order to see if i was eligible for the job. It seems as if I wasnt but I was not perturbed. I trucked on and kept on going
Interview Questions: how are you doing today? nice to meet you

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very good and rewarding. This is a very good internship and very easy to do. I recommend it for everyone. Please Please please please please. The interview process was very good and rewarding. This is a very good internship and very easy to do. I recommend it for everyone. Please Please please please please
Interview Questions: How are you today sir?

title: Career Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, completed two in person interviews. First one was a panel interview with three panelist. The second interview, I was asked to complete a presentation and do an open forum question and answer with the rest of the office staff.
Interview Questions: Experience working with diverse student populations

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach
Interview Descriptions: I applied online for a Graduate Assistant position In the CBA department. I got a call from the professor and she called for a 1:1 interview. Professor asked me the basics of excel and some commands and my experience for it.
Interview Questions: Regarding Excel and word.

title: Parking Services Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach (Long Beach, CA) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: Went to their office and started individual interview. They asked some general questions such as introduce yourself and list out greatest Strength and Weakness. How Do You Handle Stress and Pressure? Describe a Difficult Work Situation or Project and How You Handled It.
Interview Questions: Describe a Difficult Work Situation or Project and How You Handled It.

title: Character Artist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach (Long Beach, CA) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was fast and easy. HR did an amazing job at getting things done accordingly and stayed in contact throughout the whole process. It was a good experience regardless of the precedented times we're currently living in.
Interview Questions: What did you do in your previous role that you can bring over to this job role?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach (Long Beach, CA) in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: I spoke with the director about my academics, career goals, and interest in the transportation sector. Afterwards, I wrote about my work experience and academic pursuits as they relate to the position.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have writing research findings?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach (Los Angeles, CA) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: Business casual, but some what formal. Still professional, but not as nerve racking as I thought. The supervisor was super easy to talk to. You sit down and have a one on one with them. The interview felt casual. Not a super intimidating interview. By far my favorite interview experience.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach (Long Beach, CA) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: Great very easy for students. They provide  you with training they guide you through a lot and make interview less daunting then it would be elsewhere. They let you learn a lot but they also expect you to be learning fast.
Interview Questions: Whats your interest in technology?

title: Director of Information Systems Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach (Long Beach, CA) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions:
There was a phone screen call originally with an assistant. 
 Then there were four panels after that.  The first panel was with four Directors or higher staff, 2nd, and 3rd panel was with staff, 4th round was with AVP.
Interview Questions: Standard system questions and manager experiance questions.

title: Health Educator Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach (Long Beach, CA) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interview and onboarding process  were pretty seamless. You can tell that staff are invested in the professional development of employees. Full-time also begins at 32 hours which provides flexibility in your work schedule.
Interview Questions: How do you think you're qualified to fulfill expectations for the role?

title: Isa Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach (Long Beach, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, in about a week or two, I was called for interview. It was 1:1 interview. Questions were related to python more. The interview went about 30 mins or so.
Interview Questions: Questions were based on my resume mostly.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach (Long Beach, CA) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: I interviews for a Student Assistant position at California State University, Long Beach. The overall process is not difficult, you do get priority if you have federal study. Mainly general behavioral questions with a couple of questions regarding office work and more related to the position applying for.
Interview Questions: Tell me more about yourself, tell me your 5 yea plan

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach (Long Beach, CA) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with 6 interviews evaluating questions relating to clerical/administrative experience, professional habits and workflow, experience working within a diverse community, and leadership abilities. Did not receive an offer, but good learning experience for university campus positions.
Interview Questions: What is your experience with office work?

title: Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach
Interview Descriptions: One to one with the professor. Depending if you want to do the research with the same interest as him/her. If you are a good match and he/she likes you, you are more likely to get into the research assistant position.
Interview Questions: What is your major and why research are you interested in

title: Building Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was relatively simple. Met with a couple of directors and they asked generic questions as to what traits I have that would help me excel at the job.
Interview Questions: Name a scenario where you were put in a difficult situation with a customer and how did you handle it.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach (Long Beach, CA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Application, review with 3 staff, and interview questions with follow up shortly after. We sat down for about 2 hours going over questions and answers. It was fairly formal, with many employees both under and over the main supervisor whom I interacted with.
Interview Questions: Have you built a computer?

title: Employer Relations Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach (Long Beach, CA) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: Met with the Employer Relations team and had two interviews. Both interviews were a great experience. Both supervisors asked great questions that allowed me to show my skills and attributes that would make me suitable for this position.
Interview Questions: What are your greatest strengths?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach
Interview Descriptions: There are usually 2 rounds. First round is with an objective panel, and second round will be with that specific department to see if you would fit into the department. The process could be quick, within 3 weeks, or they can take over a month to get back to you.
Interview Questions:
Typical interview for government positions, basic questions. 

introduce yourself
describe your experience specific to job duties 
tell us about a time you had to solve a workplace conflict

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CSU Long Beach
Interview Descriptions: Applied through the school's career website (careerlink). Received a call about a week or two after submitting the application. Interviewed in-person once and was notified promptly about their decision. Everyone was nice and the process was really fast.
Interview Questions: Level of expertise in Microsoft Office

title: Programs Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: easy, straightforward process. Just had to submit resume and cover letter to department. Took about a month for initial interview and a week for them to get back to me
Interview Questions: What experience do you have in programs?

title: Lifeguard Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very laid back and easy.  They will ask you to demonstrate CPR moves and swim up and down the pool. Great pool manager and fun to work with.  They will work with your schedule and they will give you extra hours.
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience working with young kids?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview was straightforward. Nothing difficult. But at the end of the interview, the question was very confusing. They interviewed many people so it was possible they had better candidates before my interview. It was a good interview and enjoyed it from start to finish.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your self and research?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach (Long Beach, CA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Was asked about my skills and previous experience. I applied online and got the interview in few days. The interview was just for one day and it was easy. I worked there for 3 months. Great experience.
Interview Questions: Where did you work previously and what was your work?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CSU Long Beach
Interview Descriptions: Mostly about the previous experience. They wanted to know how fit you can be to the job knowing your current schedule at school. Communication always matter as you have to communicate with different people.
Interview Questions: My previous work experience

title: RA of Technology Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: 10 Questions Interview with two supervisors.  Both very friendly. They didn't make the interview intimidating.  The questions were basic and related to the job or how you work (as an individual or in a group).
Interview Questions: What do you think a day of this position would look like?/What do you think the RA of Tech does?

title: ESL Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach (Long Beach, CA) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: First, the hiring manager asked questions about experience, motivation, methodologies for the job position.  Then, a short grammar test was given and a role playing activity was played out between a tutor and a student
Interview Questions: What methods can you use to help students with their questions or concerns with their assignments?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CSU Long Beach
Interview Descriptions:
I applied in person. They contacted me after 2-3 weeks to schedule an infernos interview.

Interview was easy and straightforward. Just be casual and be yourself and you will be fine.
Interview Questions: why we should hire you?

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach (Long Beach, CA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: They almost ALWAYS have another staff member in mind, but have to send the job out according to state regulations and interview at least three people.  I never get the job, but always interviews
Interview Questions: A project I am particularly proud of

title: Database Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach (Long Beach, CA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Phone Screening for half n hour. Then one to one interview with senior analyst. Personal interview is based on the past experience and technical skills (specially SQL). It was very friendly.
Interview Questions: Past Experience

title: Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach (Long Beach, CA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Phone Interview: Asked about 11 questions in less than 15 minutes. There were three people on the call and the main interviewer seemed rushed. During two of the questions she could be heard whispering while I was talking, which was very distracting. They offered no additional information about the position when I asked and simply hung up after complete and didn't share any details about the next step in the process.
Interview Questions: What SIS do you use? How is this specific student population different from other students at our school? Key skills for being a good advisor? Follow up questions were asked for almost every answer I provided.

title: IT Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: An on campus interview for an IT position. It was a work study only job so the interview wasn't very tough and it was mostly behavioral questions. I did dress formally but they understood that I brought a backpack and other school things to the interview because I just got out of class.
Interview Questions: When was there a time where you had to deal with a difficult situation?

title: Math Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions:
easy question be confident, talk how organized  always answer the star talk about previous experience 
do basics math problem and calculation show interest they gonna reply back to you as soon as possible
Interview Questions: talk about yourself

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach (Long Beach, CA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Long (2days) interview process. Don't hesitate to repeat yourself as you talk to many different peoples!
It is not about the science (basic qualification would do the trick), it is about how you would fit with people and students and plans for the next 2/3 years
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach (Long Beach, CA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: good interview opportunity but I didnt get the job. they ask you some questions about background, teaching philosophy stuff like that. they are very patient and nice that I don't feel nervous.
Interview Questions: what is your teaching philosophy

title: Test Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach (Long Beach, CA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very thorough interview, inquired about why should I be hired?, what can I offer and various scenario questions that pertain to on the job experiences. It was a good interview, very informative and upfront, the interviewer clearly defined what would be expected of me if I were hired. I overall did enjoy the interview and the friendliness of the employers.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Supplemental Instruction Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach (Long Beach, CA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions:
I contacted the SI coordinator about a position they wanted filled mid-way through the semester. by email. They then scheduled an in-person interview the next day. 
The in-person interview was fairly long (about 45 minutes) and I was asked questions about my teaching/tutoring experience and my willingness to jump into a class without (much) training. The interviewer was friendly but didn't offer a lot of insight into what the position would be like. 
Overall, was a good interview process
Interview Questions: How will your experience help you to teach difficult concepts to students?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CSU Long Beach
Interview Descriptions: It was fairly quick. They really wanted high performing students. It was for tutoring students in various subjects - and it was appointment based. There was an expectation of flexibility.
Interview Questions: Name me a strength and weakness of yours

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach (Long Beach, CA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: first you apply online by following the job posting on the beachlink, ASI and 49ers jobs. Each website will ask  you to fill out the necessary detail in thier employment form. A resume is asked accordingly. The employment form and resume is submitted and sometimes a cover letter is also asked. If it is necessary. This application is received adn reviewed by the potential employer. If employer is interested they will call you for an interview. The intervieww is a smooth and quiet relaxing process.
Interview Questions: Please expain yourself.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach (Long Beach, CA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: I work in the library. I had previous experience, so there was no interview. They hire tons of students so if you just tell them you have previous experience you basically get hired on the spot.
Interview Questions: I was not interviewed, so there were no questions/

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach (Long Beach, CA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was a basic HR interview. The process was clearly defined in the email. After submitting the resume online they sent an email to confirm interview schedule. The interview was 15 minutes long.
Interview Questions: Why do you wish to work for this department?

title: Tech Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach (Long Beach, CA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview was pretty straight forward. There was a short test on basic hardware components. If you've ever built your own computer you should be fine for the small test. They are looking for people with experience with active directory, but if you don't have the experience, make sure you let them know you are willing to learn how to use it.
Interview Questions: How familiar are you with computers?

title: Teaching Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach (Long Beach, CA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Prof spoke to me for about an hour and then gave his decision in a couple of days. He tested me on my atlab skills in the previous semester when I was enrolled in a project under him.
Interview Questions: Explain the projects that you have done in Matlab.

title: CBA Graduate Programs Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach (Long Beach, CA) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Was interviewed by about 6 to 8 different people and they all had a series of questions that involved the position that I was applying for.  I believe the people in the interview were staff members to directors and faculty members.
Interview Questions: What is your experience with advisory boards ?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied for an Graduate Assistant Position by submitting my resume and cover letter to HR. 1 month later I got a straight job offer from a Professor that asked me to work in coorperation with him.
Interview Questions: no difficulties

title: MFT Trainee Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach (Long Beach, CA) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: They asked about 7 questions.  Fairly simple if you are knowledgeable of community mental health and social issues within the community.  Took about a week to hear back from the agency regarding the position.  Very welcoming and warm interview process.
Interview Questions: What theoretical approach do you find yourself more aligned to?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions:
The entire recruitment process includes: 1)attendance of an info session 2) submission of written application 3) experiential interview 4) personal interview. 

the experiential was made up of several group activities meant to convey your interpersonal and group work skills, and the personal interview was conducted by a panel of 2-5 representative of HRL.
Interview Questions: What made you want to apply for this position?

title: College Evaluator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach (Long Beach, CA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interview was good and to the point. Once I was determined to be a prospective candidate I had a final interview with the director and assistant director of the program. The whole application process took around 1-2 months.
Interview Questions: why do you want to work in this position?

title: Event Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach (Long Beach, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Very simple and lacking any real screening.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach (Long Beach, CA) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: The supervisor reviewed my application and called me. We scheduled an interview. It was brief and to the point. They offered me the position on the spot. They asked me questions based on my previous expereince.
Interview Questions: What is your availability?

title: Graduate Teaching Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach (Long Beach, CA) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was scheduled a few weeks later. I was very qualified so the interview only lasted about 10 minutes before I got the job. I was asked about my personality and then had to demonstrate some of my teaching skills to the hiring manager.
Interview Questions: The chair at the time asked a few generic questions, but mainly wanted me to demonstrate to him how I would solve a specific problem in front of a class. The problem was a fairly simple algebra exercise about simplifying some compound fraction.

title: Temporary Sales Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach
Interview Descriptions: Applied online before the new semester started and was called in for a group interview about a week or two later.  I interviewed with four other people and it was a group interview so we all had to answer the same question.  I had the misfortune of going first so I had to think quickly on my feet, but I think they liked that.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with a shoplifter?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach (Long Beach, CA) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interviewing process was quite simple. The supervisor that called me wanted me to reassure him of my Federal Work Study and asked me to bring in a valid California I.D. and a copy of my Federal Work Study confirmation. He proceeded by informing of what the job entailed and asked me for the most appropriate time for me to come and fill out paperwork and that was the end of it!
Interview Questions: Do you have Federal Work Study?

title: Front Line Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach (Long Beach, CA) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Group Interview, they go around and ask you the same question so gives u time to think about an answer if not selected first. Moreover, you are able to analyze what is a good response or bad response based on others comments. Also, most people in the panel ended up with the job. Overall, the experience was very easy and the bookstore really needs help.
Interview Questions: Define Customer Service, what does it mean to you?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach (Long Beach, CA) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Met with director of department and lead supervisor for in person interview. They explained what the department did and what the work schedule was like. They also asked me to take a typing test there to see how fast I could type.
Interview Questions: How fast you could type.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach (Long Beach, CA) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: My supervisor and chairman took the interview and analyzed everything based on my interview appearance.
Interview Questions: Do you know Labview? What experience do you have in that?

title: Student Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach (Long Beach, CA) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions:
Submitted online app, resume and cover letter online Oct 9
Contacted for interview via telephone approximately 30 days later
Interview was with the Program Director (as main interviewer) and one of their corporate partners
Main Interviewer was seemed a tad pressed for time, overwhelmed and not really present or interested
Parking can be very challenging here so allow extra time for locating it and/or walking some distance
Interview Questions: Are you versed in Social Media

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach (Long Beach, CA) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: Job found on Beach Link. I turned in my application and got a call a few days later. Easy interview, they just want to get to know how you are as a person.
Interview Questions: What do you want to do with your major?

title: Part-Time Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach (Long Beach, CA) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with Department Chair to discuss my teaching one course for one semester to replace a teacher out on leave.  We discussed my previous teaching experience.  We both determined that my teaching background and education did not quite match the teaching requirements for the course.  The interviewer told me that he liked my background and told me that he would contact me if he needed an instructor in the future for a course that was a better match for my background and education.  The interview was very pleasant.
Interview Questions: Describe your previous teaching experience and education

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach (Long Beach, CA) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: I did not have an interview for this position. I was an intern here during my senior year in high school and when I graduated the old receptionist had left, so they called me to see if I wanted to the position.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here.

title: Lead Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach (Long Beach, CA) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interview was  based on what skills you possess and your availability
Interview Questions: Can you commit to the job for an extended period of time?

title: Copywriter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach (Long Beach, CA) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: I received an email from the HR representative, who set up an in-person interview for me. I was then interviewed by a panel of 5 people (whom I would be working with closely), and each person asked me at least two questions. I was also encouraged to ask questions about the position and the organization. Shortly afterward I received a call from my now-supervisor offering me the position, and I accepted. Everyone was very friendly and easy to talk to, and I felt welcome.
Interview Questions: "Tell us about a time when you had to solve a difficult problem at work."

title: Management Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach (Long Beach, CA) in Dec 2010
Interview Descriptions: our site, and in th
Interview Questions: suspicious we will l

title: Student Services Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach (Long Beach, CA) in Oct 2010
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is highly structured. After submitting a resume online, and completing an application, I was invited for a panel interview.  There were four interviewers who took turns reading questions from a prepared set of questions. It was not very conversational and no one seemed to deviate from this prepared set of questions. When I was given an opportunity to ask questions, the panel seemed to relax a bit more. Subsequently, I was invited for a one-on-one interview with the Director.
Interview Questions: I did not find the interview difficult nor did I get any unexpected questions, although it was essential to be prepared and to understand the nature of the work and the mission of the department, as well as widely established standards for professional work in my field.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach (Long Beach, CA) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: The interview was done onsite by 2 faculty members.  Each of the pitched their experiences with the University and the objectives of the college.  They then proceeded to ask me about my experience in teaching and assistance to the community.  I answered clearly and felt OVERLY confident about the position I wanted.  I even told them that my end goal is to make it further than Graduate Assistant but to a more establish teaching position.
Interview Questions: What kind of input can you give to undergraduate students?

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at CSU Long Beach (Long Beach, CA) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: great company
Interview Questions: why do you want to work for us?
